sentence.Network_en: I must disabuse you of your feelings of grandeur.
sentence.Network_cn: 我必须去消除你的傲气.

sentence.Network_en: Their view of country people was that they like to please strangers. I did not disabuse them of this notion.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们认为乡下人爱讨好陌生人，对此观点我并未予以纠正。

sentence.Network_en: I would like to disabuse your mind of the idea that your cousin has a feeling of hostility to you. On the contrary he spoke to me in the most friendly terms of you.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想消除你以为你的堂兄对你有敌意的误会. 相反,他跟我说到你时,是以最友善的口吻说的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 求dis开头的单词 - 已解决 - 搜搜问问 ... disabler 使人残废之事物 disabuse 解惑, 释疑, 使省悟 disaccharid 二醣类.
蓝宝词典 ... ）designate vt. 任命，命名 disabuse v. 使省悟，纠正 diverge vi. 分歧；岔开.
求dis开头的单词 - 已解决 - 搜搜问问 ... disabler 使人残废之事物 disabuse 解惑, 释疑, 使省悟 disaccharid 二醣类.
Day One List 2 ... safe 保险柜 disabuse 打消错误念头 underbid 要价过低.

list.abs: 托业词汇备考... ... [induce 引诱] [ab+use disabuse 解除某人的迷惑；使醒悟] [ac+cent=cant+uate；ACCENT；cantata （音乐）清唱 …
disabuse a person of his mistaken ideas ., 纠正某人的错误想法.
Let me disabuse you of that foolish idea ., 让我纠正你那种愚蠢的想法.
disabuse sb of mistaken notions , false assumptions , etc., 使某人去掉错误的观点 , 错误的设想等.

entry.tran: 使省悟;使消除（错误观点）
entry.def: If you disabuse someone of something, you tell them or persuade them that what they believe is in fact untrue.

example.ex: Their view of country people was that they like to please strangers. I did not disabuse them of this notion.
example.tran: 他们认为乡下人爱讨好陌生人，对此观点我并未予以纠正。

auth_sentence.content: I do not disabuse them of this charming notion.
auth_sentence.res_content: I do not disabuse them of this charming notion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I do not disabuse them of this charming notion.

auth_sentence.content: He now perceived himself to be the most powerful man in English cricket, the notion of which his advisers did not disabuse him.
auth_sentence.res_content: He now perceived himself to be the most powerful man in English cricket, the notion of which his advisers did not disabuse him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He now perceived himself to be the most powerful man in English cricket, the notion of which his advisers did not disabuse him.

auth_sentence.content: But he doesn't disabuse the spooked woman, allowing her to cleave to her consoling fiction.
auth_sentence.res_content: But he doesn't disabuse the spooked woman, allowing her to cleave to her consoling fiction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he doesn't disabuse the spooked woman, allowing her to cleave to her consoling fiction.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无用的, 无效的, 无益的, 无价值的
stems_affixes.word_buile: use用+less无→adj.无用的, 无效的, 无益的, 无价值的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有用的, 有益的, 有帮手的
stems_affixes.word_buile: use用+ful表形容词→adj.有用的, 有益的, 有帮手的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使用, 利用, 耗费
stems_affixes.word_buile: use用→n.&v.使用, 利用, 耗费

stems_affixes.value_cn: 打消[某人]的错误念头,纠正
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis去掉+abuse[n.&v.滥用]→去掉滥用→纠正错误

sentences.en: If you think I’m going to lend you money, I must disabuse you of te wrong idea.
sentences.cn: 你若认为我会借钱给你，我倒要劝你打消那念头。

sentences.en: I would like to disabuse your mind of the idea that your cousin has a feeling of hostility to you. On the contrary he spoke to me in the most friendly terms of you.
sentences.cn: 我想消除你以为你的堂兄对你有敌意的误会。相反，他跟我说到你时，是以最友善的口吻说的。

sentences.en: I must disabuse you of your feelings of grandeur.
sentences.cn: 我必须去消除你的傲气。
